Description: Axe-head: with a linear design lightly chased along the middle. There are no flanges. The perforations are slightly misaligned. The end of one of the lateral tangs is slightly curved, the other ends are straight. The blade is a little warped and quite thickly corroded, especially on one face. Each of the tangs is damaged on the butt.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. A. W. Budge, ‘Archaeologia: or Miscellaneous Tracts relating to Antiquity’ 53 (London, 1892), 93, pl. II, 7; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tools and weapons : illustrated by the Egyptian collection in University College, London' (London, 1917), pl. VI, 180; W. Wolf, ‘Die Bewaffnung des altägyptischen Heeres’ (Leipzig, 1926), 33, pl. 2, 10; H. Bonnet, ‘ Die Waffen der Völker des Alten Orients’ (Leipzig, 1926), 25, fig. 12, e, and 26-7; E. Kühnert-Eggesbrecht, ‘Die Axt als Waffe und Werkzeug im alten Ägypten’ (Berlin, 1969), 101, C-V/8.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (98)
